# Post-Quantum Cryptography

Since 2016, NIST has been running a
[post-quantum cryptography project](https://csrc.nist.gov/projects/post-quantum-cryptography)
to standardize key encapsulation and signature algorithms that will be secure
in the face of future quantum computers.
Candidates for standardization were announced in July 2022.

The [CRYSTALS](https://pq-crystals.org/index.shtml) algorithms
among others were selected for standardization.
CRYSTALS-Kyber is a key-encapsulation mechanism.
CRYSTALS-Dilithium is a digital signature scheme.

You can experiment with them now!
Cloudflare integrated them into their
[circl](https://github.com/cloudflare/circl) library
to make them even easier to use.


## Demo

Just look at [main.go](https://github.com/towynlin/pqc-kyber-demo/blob/main/main.go).
It's only a few lines of code. Running it outputs something like this.

```
Alice's shared secret: f047de763450d9a011bc464bbb8c2ffe85f56f3e72ccf25d225d8f372f2b8472

Ciphertext: 

Bob's decapsulated shared secret: f047de763450d9a011bc464bbb8c2ffe85f56f3e72ccf25d225d8f372f2b8472
```
